common.name: AccordionItem
common.description: A single, collapsible panel for displaying content. It can be used individually or as part of an AccordionGroup.

props.name: title
props.description: The text content displayed in the accordion header.

props.name: modelValue
props.description: Controls whether the accordion item is open. Supports `v-model` for two-way binding.

props.name: icon
props.description: The Lucide icon name to display on the right side of the header.

props.name: iconRotateType
props.description: Defines how the icon rotates: 'rotate' (90deg for chevron-right) or 'rotate-down' (180deg for chevron-down).

events.name: update:modelValue
events.description: Emitted when the open/closed state changes, for `v-model` binding. Payload: `(newValue: boolean)`.

events.name: toggle
events.description: Emitted when the accordion header is clicked, passing the new state. Payload: `(newState: boolean)`.

slots.name: header
slots.description: Optional slot for custom content in the accordion header, overriding the `title` prop.

slots.name: content
slots.description: Slot for the collapsible content of the accordion item.

usageExamples.description: Basic individual AccordionItem usage with v-model.

common.name: AccordionGroup
common.description: A container component that manages a collection of `AccordionItem` components, providing 'exclusive' (single open) or 'multi-open' behavior.

props.name: items
props.description: An array of objects, where each object represents the data for an `AccordionItem` (e.g., `{ title: string, content: string, icon?: string, iconRotateType?: string }`).

props.name: type
props.description: Determines the behavior of the accordion group: 'exclusive' (only one item can be open at a time) or 'multi-open' (multiple items can be open simultaneously).

usageExamples.description: Exclusive AccordionGroup for FAQ sections.
Multi-open AccordionGroup for filter options.

common.name: Avatar
common.description: A versatile component for displaying user avatars, supporting image sources, initials fallback, and customizable sizes and shapes. It can also include an optional online status indicator.

props.name: src
props.description: The URL of the avatar image. If not provided, initials or a default icon will be displayed.

props.name: alt
props.description: Alt text for the avatar image, important for accessibility.

props.name: initials
props.description: Initials to display if no `src` is provided. Typically 1-3 characters.

props.name: size
props.description: Predefined sizes for the avatar (e.g., 'sm' for w-8 h-8, 'lg' for w-12 h-12). Maps to Tailwind CSS classes.

props.name: shape
props.description: The shape of the avatar. 'circle' (fully rounded), 'rounded' (partially rounded corners), 'square' (sharp corners).

props.name: online
props.description: If true, displays a green online status indicator. If false, displays a gray offline indicator. If null, no indicator is shown.

props.name: onlineIndicatorPosition
props.description: Position of the online status indicator relative to the avatar.

props.name: bgColor
props.description: Tailwind CSS background color class for the avatar if no image is present (e.g., 'blue-500', 'indigo-200').

props.name: textColor
props.description: Tailwind CSS text color class for initials (e.g., 'white', 'blue-800').

usageExamples.description: Default avatar with image source.
usageExamples.code: <Avatar src="/images/avatar-user-1.jpg" alt="John Doe" />

usageExamples.description: Avatar with initials fallback.
usageExamples.code: <Avatar initials="JD" size="lg" bgColor="blue-500" textColor="white" />

usageExamples.description: Extra large avatar with online status.
usageExamples.code: <Avatar src="/images/avatar-user-2.jpg" alt="Jane Smith" size="xl" :online="true" />

usageExamples.description: Square avatar with offline status.
usageExamples.code: <Avatar src="/images/avatar-user-3.jpg" alt="Alice" size="md" shape="square" :online="false" />

usageExamples.description: Small avatar with initials and custom background/text color.
usageExamples.code: <Avatar initials="AB" size="sm" bgColor="purple-200" textColor="purple-800" />

usageExamples.description: Rounded (not fully circular) avatar with online status at top-left.
usageExamples.code:
<Avatar
  src="/images/avatar-user-4.jpg"
  alt="Bob"
  size="lg"
  shape="rounded"
  :online="true"
  online-indicator-position="top-left"
/>

common.name: Badge
common.description: A versatile component for displaying small, descriptive labels or status indicators. Supports various colors, filled or outline styles, and optional Lucide icons.

props.name: color
props.description: Sets the primary color theme of the badge.

props.name: type
props.description: Defines the visual style of the badge: 'filled' (solid background) or 'outline' (border only).

props.name: icon
props.description: The name of a Lucide icon to display before the text (e.g., 'check-circle', 'star', 'alert-triangle', 'clock', 'tag').

props.name: iconFillColor
props.description: Tailwind color class (e.g., 'blue-500') to apply a fill color to the icon. Useful for icons that support fill (like 'star').

slots.name: default
slots.description: Used for the main text content of the badge.

usageExamples.description: Basic filled badge.
usageExamples.code: <Badge color="green">Active</Badge>

usageExamples.description: Outline badge with an icon.
usageExamples.code: <Badge type="outline" color="indigo" icon="tag">Category</Badge>

usageExamples.description: Filled badge with an icon and custom icon fill color.
usageExamples.code: <Badge color="blue" icon="star" icon-fill-color="blue-500">Featured</Badge>

common.name: NotificationBadge
common.description: A specialized component for displaying numerical counts or simple dots, typically overlaid on another element (like a button or icon), indicating notifications or new items.

props.name: count
props.description: The number or text to display within the badge. If `isDot` is true, this prop is ignored.

props.name: isDot
props.description: If true, the badge will render as a small colored dot without any text.

props.name: color
props.description: Sets the background color of the notification badge.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Used for the element (e.g., button, icon) that the notification badge is attached to.

usageExamples.description: Notification badge with a count over an icon.
Notification badge as a dot over a button.
usageExamples.code:

</NotificationBadge>

common.description: A container for grouping multiple Button components.

common.name: Icon
common.description: A reusable Vue component for rendering Lucide Icons. It simplifies icon usage by abstracting the `data-lucide` attribute and providing props for common styling properties like name, size, and color. It ensures proper rendering by integrating `lucide.createIcons()` on mount and prop changes.

props.name: name
props.description: The official name of the Lucide icon to display (e.g., 'check', 'alert-triangle', 'settings', 'bell'). Refer to the Lucide Icons website (https://lucide.dev/icons/) for a full list of available icons.

props.name: size
props.description: Controls the visual size of the icon. Predefined values map to Tailwind `w-X h-X` classes. You can also pass raw Tailwind size classes directly. Valid predefined values: 'sm' (w-4 h-4), 'md' (w-5 h-5), 'lg' (w-6 h-6), 'xl' (w-8 h-8), '2xl' (w-10 h-10), '3xl' (w-12 h-12).

props.name: color
props.description: Sets the color of the icon using Tailwind CSS text color utility classes. Use 'current' to inherit the text color from the parent element (e.g., 'blue-500', 'red-700', 'gray-600').

props.name: ariaLabel
props.description: An optional accessibility label for screen readers, describing the icon's purpose. If not provided, it defaults to "{icon-name} icon".

usageExamples.description: A medium-sized settings icon in gray.
usageExamples.code: <Icon name="settings" size="md" color="gray-600" aria-label="Settings icon" />

usageExamples.description: A large download icon in a primary color, within a button.
usageExamples.code:
<button class="flex items-center px-3 py-2 bg-blue-500 text-white rounded-md">
  <Icon name="download" size="md" color="white" class="mr-2" />
  Download
</button>

usageExamples.description: A small mail icon with accompanying text.
usageExamples.code: Check your inbox.

usageExamples.description: Custom size icon using direct Tailwind classes.
usageExamples.code: <Icon name="activity" size="w-7 h-7" color="teal-500" />

usageExamples.description: Standard icon examples (sm, md, lg, 2xl) with various colors.
usageExamples.code:
<Icon name="check" size="sm" color="green-500" aria-label="Checkmark icon" />
<Icon name="sun" size="md" color="yellow-500" aria-label="Sun icon" />
<Icon name="database" size="lg" color="indigo-600" aria-label="Database icon" />
<Icon name="bar-chart-2" size="2xl" color="pink-600" aria-label="Bar chart icon" />

usageExamples.description: Action icon within a circular button, inheriting color.
usageExamples.code:
<button class="p-2 rounded-full text-red-500 hover:bg-red-100 hover:text-red-700 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-red-300 transition-colors duration-200" aria-label="Delete Item">
  <Icon name="trash-2" size="lg" color="current" />
</button>

common.name: Link
common.description: The `Link` component provides a flexible way to create various types of clickable navigation elements, from simple text links to styled buttons and icon-based actions. It integrates with Vue Router for internal navigation and handles external links and disabled states gracefully.

props.name: to
props.description: The destination URL or Vue Router path. Use a full URL for external links (e.g., 'https://example.com') or a relative path for internal routes (e.g., '/admin/dashboard').

props.name: text
props.description: The visible text for the link. This prop is used for `text`, `icon-text`, `button`, and `button-icon` variants. For `icon-only`, the text prop is ignored, and `aria-label` should be used for accessibility.

props.name: variant
props.description: Defines the visual style and behavior of the link. Valid values: `'text'` (Default: standard text link), `'button'` (button-like styling), `'icon-only'` (icon-only link), `'icon-text'` (icon followed by text), `'button-icon'` (button-like link with icon and text).

props.name: icon
props.description: A Lucide icon name to display. Required for `'icon-only'`, `'icon-text'`, and `'button-icon'` variants (e.g., 'external-link', 'download', 'edit').

props.name: size
props.description: Controls the size for button and icon variants. (Corresponds to w-X h-X or padding values).

props.name: color
props.description: The primary Tailwind text color class for the link (e.g., 'blue-500', 'gray-700'). For `button` variants, this is used as a fallback if `bgColor` is not provided.

props.name: bgColor
props.description: A Tailwind background color class for `'button'` and `'button-icon'` variants (e.g., 'indigo-600', 'red-600'). Overrides `color` for background.

props.name: borderColor
props.description: A Tailwind border color class for `'button'` and `'button-icon'` variants, useful for outlined buttons (e.g., 'gray-300').

props.name: newTab
props.description: If `true`, the link will open in a new browser tab (`target="_blank"`).

props.name: isDisabled
props.description: If `true`, the link will be visually styled as disabled and its navigation will be programmatically prevented. Also sets `aria-disabled="true"` for accessibility.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Used for additional content or more complex internal structures within the link, complementing or replacing the `text` prop.

usageExamples.description: Basic text link to an internal route.
usageExamples.code:
<template>
  <Link to="/admin/settings" text="Go to Settings" color="purple-600" />
</template>

<script setup>
import { Link } from '@/components/common';
</script>

dataDisplay.name: Card
dataDisplay.description: The `Card` component provides a flexible container for displaying various types of content in a visually distinct block. It supports icons, images, progress bars, and custom content via slots.

props.name: title
props.description: The main title displayed on the card.

props.name: description
props.description: A brief descriptive text for the card.

props.name: bgColor
props.description: Tailwind color class for the background (e.g., 'white', 'yellow-50').

props.name: textColor
props.description: Tailwind color class for the primary text.

props.name: borderColor
props.description: Tailwind color class for a border (e.g., 'yellow-200').

props.name: flexDirection
props.description: Layout of card content ('flex-col' or 'flex-row').

props.name: alignItems
props.description: Tailwind alignment for items ('items-start', 'items-center', 'items-end').

props.name: justifyContent
props.description: Tailwind justify for items ('justify-start', 'justify-center', 'justify-between').

props.name: gap
props.description: Tailwind spacing between items ('space-y-4', 'space-x-4', etc.).

props.name: textCenter
props.description: If true, main text content will be centered.

props.name: icon
props.description: Lucide icon name to display (e.g., 'truck', 'alert-triangle').

props.name: iconSize
props.description: Tailwind size classes for the icon.

props.name: iconBgColor
props.description: Tailwind color class for the icon's background.

props.name: iconColor
props.description: Tailwind color class for the icon itself.

props.name: iconPadding
props.description: Tailwind padding for the icon container.

props.name: imageUrl
props.description: URL for an image to display.

props.name: imageAlt
props.description: Alt text for the image.

props.name: imageShape
props.description: Tailwind classes for image styling.

props.name: value
props.description: A main value to display (e.g., '75%').

props.name: valueSize
props.description: Tailwind size class for the value.

props.name: valueColor
props.description: Tailwind color class for the value.

props.name: progressBarValue
props.description: Percentage (0-100) for a progress bar.

props.name: progressBarColor
props.description: Tailwind color for the progress bar.

props.name: progressText
props.description: Additional text for the progress bar.

props.name: progressTextColor
props.description: Tailwind color for progress text.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Used for any additional content in the card body, placed after the main title/description/value.

slots.name: actions
slots.description: Used for action buttons or links typically placed at the bottom of the card. Content within this slot can be arranged using flexbox utilities provided by the parent.

usageExamples.description: Simple Info Card with an icon and action button.
usageExamples.code:
<template>
  <Card

dataDisplay.name: Carousel
dataDisplay.description: The `Carousel` component provides a dynamic and interactive way to display a collection of images or content in a rotating sequence. It supports navigation arrows, pagination dots, and optional auto-play functionality.

props.name: slides
props.description: An array of objects, where each object represents a slide. Each slide object should ideally have `src` (String) and `alt` (String) properties. An optional `text` (String) property can be included for overlay content when using the default slot.

props.name: autoPlay
props.description: If `true`, the carousel will automatically advance slides.

props.name: interval
props.description: The duration (in milliseconds) between automatic slide transitions when `autoPlay` is `true`.

props.name: showDots
props.description: If `true`, navigation dots will be displayed at the bottom of the carousel.

props.name: showArrows
props.description: If `true`, navigation arrows (previous/next) will be displayed on the sides of the carousel.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Allows for highly customizable slide content. When using this slot, the component passes `slide` (the current slide object) and `index` (the current slide's index) as slot props, allowing you to build complex slide layouts. If you don't use this slot, the component will render a basic `` tag using `slide.src` and `slide.alt`, and an optional text overlay if `slide.text` is provided.

usageExamples.description: Basic Carousel with Arrows (no auto-play, no dots).
usageExamples.code:
<template>
  <Carousel
    :slides="productSlides"
    :show-autoplay="false"
    :show-dots="false"
    :show-arrows="true"
  />
</template>

<script setup>
import { reactive } from 'vue';
import { Carousel } from '@/components/dataDisplay';

const productSlides = reactive([
  { src: 'path/to/burger.jpg', alt: 'Delicious Burger' },
  { src: 'path/to/fries.jpg', alt: 'Crispy Fries' },
]);
</script>

usageExamples.description: Auto-playing Carousel with Dots and custom slide content.

dataDisplay.description: A versatile wrapper component for Chart.js, enabling the rendering of various data visualizations (bar, line, pie, doughnut, etc.). It provides dynamic data and options management.

props.name: chartId

props.name: chartType

props.name: chartData

props.name: chartOptions

dataDisplay.name: CommentItem
dataDisplay.description: The `CommentItem` component is used to render a single comment, supporting author information, content, timestamp, and interactive buttons for replies, edits, and deletions. It also supports nested replies.

props.name: comment
props.description: An object representing the comment, with properties: `id` (String), `author` (String), `avatar` (String, optional), `timestamp` (String), `content` (String), `role` (String, optional - 'user' or 'admin'), and `replies` (Array, optional - an array of nested Comment objects for replies).

props.name: bgColor
props.description: Tailwind CSS class for the background color of the comment item.

props.name: isReply
props.description: Internal prop used to apply indentation for nested replies.

events.name: reply
events.description: Emitted when the 'Reply' button is clicked, passing the ID of the comment being replied to.

events.name: edit
events.description: Emitted when the 'Edit' button is clicked, passing the comment ID and its current text.

events.name: delete
events.description: Emitted when the 'Delete' button is clicked, passing the comment ID.

usageExamples.description: Basic usage of CommentItem within a list.
usageExamples.code:
<template>
  <CommentItem
    :comment="{
      id: 'c1',
      author: 'John Doe',
      avatar: 'https://example.com/avatar.jpg',
      timestamp: '2 hours ago',
      content: 'This is a sample comment.',
      role: 'user',
      replies: []
    }"
    bgColor="bg-white"
  />
</template>

<script setup>
import { CommentItem } from '@/components/dataDisplay';
// Define your comment object as needed
</script>

dataDisplay.name: CommentSection

props.name: title

props.name: currentUserAvatar

props.name: currentUserName

dataDisplay.name: DataTable
dataDisplay.description: The `DataTable` component is a versatile solution for displaying tabular data. It supports various configurations including basic display, striped rows, hover effects, sortable columns, fixed headers for scrollable content, and built-in pagination.

props.name: headers
props.description: An array of objects defining table columns. Each object should have: `text` (String - display text), `value` (String - data key), `sortable` (Boolean, optional - enables sorting for this column if `DataTable` sortable prop is true), `isPrimary` (Boolean, optional - applies emphasis style), `class` (String, optional - custom Tailwind classes), `align` (String, optional - 'left' | 'center' | 'right').

props.name: data
props.description: An array of objects, where each object represents a row in the table. Keys in objects should match `value` properties in `headers`.

props.name: striped
props.description: If `true`, applies alternating row background colors.

props.name: hoverable
props.description: If `true`, rows will change background color on hover.

props.name: sortable
props.description: If `true`, enables global sorting functionality for columns marked `sortable: true` in `headers`.

props.name: initialSortKey
props.description: The initial column key to sort by.

props.name: initialSortDirection
props.description: The initial sort direction ('asc' or 'desc').

props.name: scrollable
props.description: If `true`, the table body will be scrollable with a fixed header (max height `h-72`).

props.name: paginate
props.description: If `true`, enables basic client-side pagination controls below the table.

props.name: itemsPerPage
props.description: Number of rows to display per page when pagination is enabled.

events.name: sort
events.description: Emitted when a sortable column header is clicked, providing the sort key and direction.

events.name: page-change
events.description: Emitted when the pagination page changes, providing the new current page number.

slots.name: item-{header.value}
slots.description: A dynamic slot for customizing individual cell content. Replace `{header.value}` with the `value` property of the header (e.g., `#item-status`). Receives `item` (cell value) and `row` (entire row object).

slots.name: actions
slots.description: A slot for defining actions (e.g., edit, delete buttons) in the last column. Only rendered if provided. Receives `row` (entire row object).

dataDisplay.name: FeedItem
dataDisplay.description: The `FeedItem` component is designed for displaying single lines of activity or notifications, typically used in a list or timeline format.

props.name: icon
props.description: The Lucide icon name to display (e.g., 'shopping-cart', 'bell').

props.name: iconColor
props.description: Tailwind CSS class for the icon color (e.g., 'indigo-600', 'red-500'). Note: The showcase uses direct color names like 'indigo-600' which are then prepended with 'text-' in the component via a computed property.

props.name: message
props.description: The main text content of the feed item. HTML can be used for formatting (e.g., `<span>` for bold/medium text, `<a>` for links).

props.name: timestamp
props.description: A short string indicating when the activity occurred (e.g., 'Just now', '1 hour ago').

props.name: bgColor
props.description: Tailwind CSS class for the background color of the feed item (e.g., 'gray-50', 'white'). Note: The showcase uses direct color names like 'gray-50' which are then prepended with 'bg-' in the component via a computed property.

props.name: textColor
props.description: Tailwind CSS class for the main message text color. Note: The showcase uses direct color names like 'gray-800' which are then prepended with 'text-' in the component via a computed property.

feedback.name: Alert
feedback.description: A flexible component for displaying various types of alerts and banners, including success, error, warning, informational, and action-oriented messages. Supports dismissible functionality and custom icons.

props.name: type
props.description: Defines the visual style and default icon of the alert.

props.name: title
props.description: The main heading or short summary of the alert.

props.name: message
props.description: The detailed message content of the alert.

props.name: dismissible
props.description: If true, a close ('x') button will be displayed, allowing the user to dismiss the alert.

props.name: actionButtonText
props.description: If provided, an action button will be displayed on the right side of the alert (e.g., 'Reconnect', 'View Details').

props.name: customIcon
props.description: A Lucide icon name to override the default icon associated with the 'type' prop (e.g., 'download', 'bell').

events.name: dismiss
events.description: Emitted when the dismiss button is clicked and the alert starts to fade out. Useful for triggering parent component logic (e.g., removing the alert from a list).

events.name: action-click
events.description: Emitted when the optional action button is clicked. Useful for triggering specific actions like navigating or performing an API call.

slots.name: default
slots.description: The default slot is not explicitly used for content insertion in this component's current structure, as title and message are passed via props. All content is managed internally.

usageExamples.description: Basic success alert, dismissible.
usageExamples.code:

 type="success"
 title="Success!"
 message="Your data was saved."
 :dismissible="true"
 @dismiss="handleSuccessDismiss"
/>

usageExamples.description: Warning alert, non-dismissible.

/>

feedback.name: ConfirmationDialog
feedback.description: A modal dialog component used to ask for user confirmation before proceeding with an action. It supports different visual cues (icons, colors) based on the type of confirmation required.

props.name: id
props.description: A unique ID for the modal element, used for accessibility attributes.

props.name: isOpen
props.description: Controls the visibility of the dialog. Use with `v-model:isOpen` for two-way binding.

props.name: title
props.description: The main title of the confirmation dialog.

props.name: message
props.description: The descriptive message explaining the action requiring confirmation.

props.name: icon
props.description: The Lucide icon name to display (e.g., 'alert-triangle', 'check-circle', 'save').

props.name: iconColor
props.description: Tailwind CSS class for the icon color (e.g., 'red-600', 'green-600').

props.name: iconBgColor
props.description: Tailwind CSS class for the background color of the icon circle (e.g., 'red-100', 'green-100').

props.name: confirmButtonText
props.description: Text for the confirmation button.

props.name: confirmButtonColor
props.description: The base color for the confirm button (e.g., 'red', 'green', 'indigo'), passed to your Button component.

props.name: confirmButtonVariantStyle
props.description: The style variant for the confirm button ('filled', 'outline', 'ghost', 'link'), passed to your Button component.

props.name: confirmButtonSize
props.description: Size for the confirmation button. (e.g., 'sm', 'md', 'lg').

props.name: cancelButtonText
props.description: Text for the cancel button.

props.name: cancelButtonColor
props.description: The base color for the cancel button (e.g., 'gray', 'red'), passed to your Button component.

props.name: cancelButtonVariantStyle
props.description: The style variant for the cancel button ('filled', 'outline', 'ghost', 'link'), passed to your Button component.

props.name: cancelButtonSize
props.description: Size for the cancel button.

props.name: disabled
props.description: If `true`, all buttons within the dialog will be disabled.

events.name: update:isOpen
events.description: Emitted when the dialog's visibility changes (e.g., closed by button or backdrop), for two-way binding with `v-model:isOpen`.

events.name: confirm
events.description: Emitted when the confirmation button is clicked.

events.name: cancel
events.description: Emitted when the cancel button, close icon, or backdrop is clicked, or Escape key is pressed.

usageExamples.description: Basic delete confirmation dialog.
usageExamples.code:
<template>
 <Button color="red" variant="filled" @click="showDeleteModal = true"> Delete Item </Button>
 <ConfirmationDialog
  id="delete-item-dialog"
  v-model:is-open="showDeleteModal"
  title="Confirm Deletion"
  message="Are you sure you want to permanently delete this item? This action cannot be undone."
  icon="alert-triangle"
  icon-color="red-600"
  icon-bg-color="red-100"
  confirm-button-text="Delete"
  confirm-button-color="red"
  confirm-button-variant-style="filled"
  @confirm="handleDeleteConfirm"
  @cancel="handleDeleteCancel"
 />
</template>

<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { Button, ConfirmationDialog } from '@/components/common'; // Adjust import based on your index.js

const showDeleteModal = ref(false);
const handleDeleteConfirm = () => { /* ... delete logic ... */ showDeleteModal.value = false; };
const handleDeleteCancel = () => { showDeleteModal.value = false; };
</script>

feedback.name: Tooltip
feedback.description: A small, contextual popup that displays information about an element when the user hovers over or focuses on it. It supports plain text or rich HTML content and various positioning options.

props.name: text
props.description: The simple text content for the tooltip. This prop is used if the `#content` slot is not provided.

props.name: position
props.description: Determines the placement of the tooltip relative to its trigger element. Accepted values: `'top'`, `'bottom'`, `'left'`, `'right'`.

props.name: showDelay
props.description: The delay in milliseconds before the tooltip appears after the trigger element is hovered or focused.

props.name: hideDelay
props.description: The delay in milliseconds before the tooltip hides after the mouse leaves or focus shifts from the trigger element.

props.name: modelValue
props.description: A v-model compatible prop to programmatically control the visibility of the tooltip. Emits `update:modelValue`.

events.name: update:modelValue
events.description: Emitted with `true` or `false` when the tooltip's visibility changes (for v-model usage).

events.name: show
events.description: Emitted when the tooltip becomes visible.

events.name: hide
events.description: Emitted when the tooltip becomes hidden.

slots.name: default
slots.description: This slot is used for the **trigger element** (the element that, when hovered/focused, shows the tooltip).

slots.name: content
slots.description: Use this named slot to provide **richer HTML content** for the tooltip itself. If this slot is provided, the `text` prop will be ignored.

usageExamples.description: Basic tooltip with text and top position.

</Tooltip>

  </button>
</Tooltip>
